summary: Hey remember when Tessa Thompson said she thought of the other Valkyrie killed in the flash back as more of lover than a friend...

blog.name: why-i-love-comics
blog.title: A blog dedicated to all your favorite moments
blog.description: Batman, Say it fast. Really fast. As fast as you can. Over and over. So what do you hear? Badman. Bad. Man. Batman. Badman. To me... Now and forever... one and                                             the same. - Peter J. Tomasi                                                                         all spoiler posts are tagged "wednesday spoilers"                                             add me on snapchapt! taskrnaster (with an RN instead of M)

tags: Fic: How Big How Blue How Beautiful
summary: I AM A HUGE IDIOT. For that, let’s wind back a couple years, to the X-Men movies. The first trilogy. I really enjoyed it, a lot....
body:
I AM A HUGE IDIOT.

For that, let’s wind back a couple years, to the X-Men movies. The first trilogy. I really enjoyed it, a lot. And I loved Storm a lot. Being me, I researched the X-Men, their backgrounds and all.

Fast forward to the announcement of Civil War. And the inclusion of the Black Panther on the cast. To me, that name meant nothing aside from “Oh. That is Storm’s (ex-)husband! I am curious to meet Storm’s husband!”.

And I liked T’Challa. Then, the Black Panther movie hit and I love T’Challa. He’s a great character and a gentle soul.

Now, back to the now.

I have been watching X-Men: Evolution and recently finished it. And it made my love for Storm flare up a lot. She is so amazing.

And now I am writing my first Avengers fic - How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful - and was asked in a comment if T’Challa will be shipped with anyone.

And this is where the idiot-part comes in. Because I am not bound by copyright issues between the X-Men and the Avengers. Absolutely nothing is stopping me from having Ororo and T’Challa meet and fall in love.

If canon will never give me content on this ship that I have been curious about for years, then I will just make my own content.

I really think that Evolution!Storm and MCU!T’Challa would be a beautiful match. And I know exactly how to bring Storm into this, how to make them meet.

I swear, I am just filling this fic with all the things I have always headcanoned or wanted to see happen in the MCU. And I am having so much fun with it.

summary: I feel like if Thor ever got into video games he’d mostly like to play the ones where you play as a female protagonist. If the...
body:
I feel like if Thor ever got into video games he’d mostly like to play the ones where you play as a female protagonist. If the game gives him a choice then he’ll always choose female.

Someone back me up on this.

tags: I AM FLIPPING MY SHIT THIS SHOW IS SO GOOD
EVERYBODY WHO HASN’T SEEN IT NEEDS TO WATCH IT ASAP
summary:
so i finally watched the aos s5 finale... my thoughts, if anyone was wondering:
tbh i agreed with Yo-Yo on like,, everything and...
body:
so i finally watched the aos s5 finale… my thoughts, if anyone was wondering:

  • tbh i agreed with Yo-Yo on like,, everything and Daisy wasn’t ready to lead
  • so making Mack the director?? genius. sometimes his morals are annoyingly righteous but still
  • also the whole Talbot thing? what the heck? i’m so confused and i feel bad for his son
  • so now that Daisy injected herself with the centipede stuff and Jiaying’s weird genes, does that mean that Daisy is now immortal? will she be able to “regenerate” like her mom?
  • omg when Fitz died i died too. that was… heart wrenching.
  • seriously i’ve said it before and i’ll say it again: Iain de Caestecker invented acting. when Fitz’s hands started shaking and his voice got all wobbly and he kept talking about how he couldn’t feel his legs??? the tears were pouring
  • “mack i think my legs are broken” is the new “mr stark i don’t feel so good”
  • buuuut i totally forgot about the whole second Fitz who’s just floating around in space
  • HOWEVER, if they find space Fitz and wake him up, wouldn’t that change everything that happened in the future? and then Fitz wouldn’t save everyone and they wouldn’t return to the past (or at least not under the same circumstances) and then they’d all be back where they started, and none of season 5 would matter.
  • y’all i watched Doctor Who i know how time travel works and honestly?? they should leave Fitz in space. it’s too risky to mess with his timeline
  • also Deke evaporated so it’s possible that FitzSimmons never even get back together
  • oh that’s really sad. now i’m sad.
  • like even if they do get Fitz back, he won’t know what happened while he was frozen
  • he won’t know that he got married to the love of his life
  • UGH.
  • thanks, Enoch. (i’m allowed to blame the entirety of this season on Enoch and the Chronicoms, right?)
  • okay now let’s talk about Coulson. he’s dead, right? i mean, he only had a few days left
  • i didn’t really feel much emotional impact during the farewell scene? at first i thought they were mourning Fitz and then Coulson’s all like, “it’s not a funeral, i’m not dead yet”
  • what’s S.H.I.E.L.D. gonna be like without Coulson?? i mean unless they somehow save him, which i doubt because he was pretty clear about not wanting to be saved
  • oh and they mentioned Thanos, but they never showed anyone turning to dust…
  • i gotta know who disappeared
  • what if Fitz turns to dust while in space and ruins the timeline??
  • or what if coulson turns to dust and when everyone is brought back in Avengers 4 he’s somehow healed?
  • i have so many questions
  • overall, really solid season. everyone’s character grew and i thought all the plot twists were interesting
  • that one episode where Fitz had a psychic split??? HOLY CRAP. two Fitz’s arguing with each other?? the “you. are. WEAK” scene had me in tears. like Fitz was so clearly afraid of himself and what he was capable of. and then Daisy’s like, “who are you talking to” and just. yikes. wow. i’m in awe
  • i wish they had talked about Fitz’s condition more. there were a lot of repercussions from the Framework but there wasn’t much discussion about Fitz’s mental state
  • oooh, but that episode where Hunter breaks Fitz out of jail?? golden. i need more Bobbi and Hunter content.
  • also i wanted more about Yo-Yo and Mack. they argued a lot this season but they never had an in-depth conversation where they officially made up
  • anywho, like i said, solid season. i love all the characters and i love the cast so mcfreakin much.
  • (sidenote, i didn’t really talk about May that much but as usual, she kicked a lot of ass and her subplot with Robin was so sweet)
  • i can’t believe i have to wait until summer of 2019 for season 6. i physically cannot wait that long.

reblog.comment:

  • tbh i agreed with Yo-Yo on like,, everything and Daisy wasn’t ready to lead
  • so making Mack the director?? genius. sometimes his morals are annoyingly righteous but still
  • also the whole Talbot thing? what the heck? i’m so confused and i feel bad for his son
  • so now that Daisy injected herself with the centipede stuff and Jiaying’s weird genes, does that mean that Daisy is now immortal? will she be able to “regenerate” like her mom?
  • omg when Fitz died i died too. that was… heart wrenching.
  • seriously i’ve said it before and i’ll say it again: Iain de Caestecker invented acting. when Fitz’s hands started shaking and his voice got all wobbly and he kept talking about how he couldn’t feel his legs??? the tears were pouring
  • “mack i think my legs are broken” is the new “mr stark i don’t feel so good”
  • buuuut i totally forgot about the whole second Fitz who’s just floating around in space
  • HOWEVER, if they find space Fitz and wake him up, wouldn’t that change everything that happened in the future? and then Fitz wouldn’t save everyone and they wouldn’t return to the past (or at least not under the same circumstances) and then they’d all be back where they started, and none of season 5 would matter.
  • y’all i watched Doctor Who i know how time travel works and honestly?? they should leave Fitz in space. it’s too risky to mess with his timeline
  • also Deke evaporated so it’s possible that FitzSimmons never even get back together
  • oh that’s really sad. now i’m sad.
  • like even if they do get Fitz back, he won’t know what happened while he was frozen
  • he won’t know that he got married to the love of his life
  • UGH.
  • thanks, Enoch. (i’m allowed to blame the entirety of this season on Enoch and the Chronicoms, right?)
  • okay now let’s talk about Coulson. he’s dead, right? i mean, he only had a few days left
  • i didn’t really feel much emotional impact during the farewell scene? at first i thought they were mourning Fitz and then Coulson’s all like, “it’s not a funeral, i’m not dead yet”
  • what’s S.H.I.E.L.D. gonna be like without Coulson?? i mean unless they somehow save him, which i doubt because he was pretty clear about not wanting to be saved
  • oh and they mentioned Thanos, but they never showed anyone turning to dust…

  • what if Fitz turns to dust while in space and ruins the timeline??
  • or what if coulson turns to dust and when everyone is brought back in Avengers 4 he’s somehow healed?
  • i have so many questions
  • overall, really solid season. everyone’s character grew and i thought all the plot twists were interesting
  • that one episode where Fitz had a psychic split??? HOLY CRAP. two Fitz’s arguing with each other?? the “you. are. WEAK” scene had me in tears. like Fitz was so clearly afraid of himself and what he was capable of. and then Daisy’s like, “who are you talking to” and just. yikes. wow. i’m in awe
  • i wish they had talked about Fitz’s condition more. there were a lot of repercussions from the Framework but there wasn’t much discussion about Fitz’s mental state
  • oooh, but that episode where Hunter breaks Fitz out of jail?? golden. i need more Bobbi and Hunter content.
  • also i wanted more about Yo-Yo and Mack. they argued a lot this season but they never had an in-depth conversation where they officially made up
  • anywho, like i said, solid season. i love all the characters and i love the cast so mcfreakin much.
  • (sidenote, i didn’t really talk about May that much but as usual, she kicked a lot of ass and her subplot with Robin was so sweet)
  • i can’t believe i have to wait until summer of 2019 for season 6. i physically cannot wait that long.

  • i didn’t really feel much emotional impact during the farewell scene? at first i thought they were mourning Fitz and then Coulson’s all like, “it’s not a funeral, i’m not dead yet”
  • what’s S.H.I.E.L.D. gonna be like without Coulson?? i mean unless they somehow save him, which i doubt because he was pretty clear about not wanting to be saved
  • oh and they mentioned Thanos, but they never showed anyone turning to dust…
  • i gotta know who disappeared
  • what if Fitz turns to dust while in space and ruins the timeline??
  • or what if coulson turns to dust and when everyone is brought back in Avengers 4 he’s somehow healed?
  • i have so many questions
  • overall, really solid season. everyone’s character grew and i thought all the plot twists were interesting
  • that one episode where Fitz had a psychic split??? HOLY CRAP. two Fitz’s arguing with each other?? the “you. are. WEAK” scene had me in tears. like Fitz was so clearly afraid of himself and what he was capable of. and then Daisy’s like, “who are you talking to” and just. yikes. wow. i’m in awe
  • i wish they had talked about Fitz’s condition more. there were a lot of repercussions from the Framework but there wasn’t much discussion about Fitz’s mental state
  • oooh, but that episode where Hunter breaks Fitz out of jail?? golden. i need more Bobbi and Hunter content.
  • also i wanted more about Yo-Yo and Mack. they argued a lot this season but they never had an in-depth conversation where they officially made up
  • anywho, like i said, solid season. i love all the characters and i love the cast so mcfreakin much.
  • (sidenote, i didn’t really talk about May that much but as usual, she kicked a lot of ass and her subplot with Robin was so sweet)
  • i can’t believe i have to wait until summer of 2019 for season 6. i physically cannot wait that long.
trail.content:
so i finally watched the aos s5 finale… my thoughts, if anyone was wondering:

  • tbh i agreed with Yo-Yo on like,, everything and Daisy wasn’t ready to lead
  • so making Mack the director?? genius. sometimes his morals are annoyingly righteous but still
  • also the whole Talbot thing? what the heck? i’m so confused and i feel bad for his son
  • so now that Daisy injected herself with the centipede stuff and Jiaying’s weird genes, does that mean that Daisy is now immortal? will she be able to “regenerate” like her mom?
  • omg when Fitz died i died too. that was… heart wrenching.
  • seriously i’ve said it before and i’ll say it again: Iain de Caestecker invented acting. when Fitz’s hands started shaking and his voice got all wobbly and he kept talking about how he couldn’t feel his legs??? the tears were pouring
  • “mack i think my legs are broken” is the new “mr stark i don’t feel so good”
  • buuuut i totally forgot about the whole second Fitz who’s just floating around in space
  • HOWEVER, if they find space Fitz and wake him up, wouldn’t that change everything that happened in the future? and then Fitz wouldn’t save everyone and they wouldn’t return to the past (or at least not under the same circumstances) and then they’d all be back where they started, and none of season 5 would matter.
  • y’all i watched Doctor Who i know how time travel works and honestly?? they should leave Fitz in space. it’s too risky to mess with his timeline
  • also Deke evaporated so it’s possible that FitzSimmons never even get back together
  • oh that’s really sad. now i’m sad.
  • like even if they do get Fitz back, he won’t know what happened while he was frozen
  • he won’t know that he got married to the love of his life
  • UGH.
  • thanks, Enoch. (i’m allowed to blame the entirety of this season on Enoch and the Chronicoms, right?)
  • okay now let’s talk about Coulson. he’s dead, right? i mean, he only had a few days left
  • i didn’t really feel much emotional impact during the farewell scene? at first i thought they were mourning Fitz and then Coulson’s all like, “it’s not a funeral, i’m not dead yet”
  • what’s S.H.I.E.L.D. gonna be like without Coulson?? i mean unless they somehow save him, which i doubt because he was pretty clear about not wanting to be saved
  • oh and they mentioned Thanos, but they never showed anyone turning to dust…
  • i gotta know who disappeared
  • what if Fitz turns to dust while in space and ruins the timeline??
  • or what if coulson turns to dust and when everyone is brought back in Avengers 4 he’s somehow healed?
  • i have so many questions
  • overall, really solid season. everyone’s character grew and i thought all the plot twists were interesting
  • that one episode where Fitz had a psychic split??? HOLY CRAP. two Fitz’s arguing with each other?? the “you. are. WEAK” scene had me in tears. like Fitz was so clearly afraid of himself and what he was capable of. and then Daisy’s like, “who are you talking to” and just. yikes. wow. i’m in awe
  • i wish they had talked about Fitz’s condition more. there were a lot of repercussions from the Framework but there wasn’t much discussion about Fitz’s mental state
  • oooh, but that episode where Hunter breaks Fitz out of jail?? golden. i need more Bobbi and Hunter content.
  • also i wanted more about Yo-Yo and Mack. they argued a lot this season but they never had an in-depth conversation where they officially made up
  • anywho, like i said, solid season. i love all the characters and i love the cast so mcfreakin much.
  • (sidenote, i didn’t really talk about May that much but as usual, she kicked a lot of ass and her subplot with Robin was so sweet)
  • i can’t believe i have to wait until summer of 2019 for season 6. i physically cannot wait that long.
